statement.p: Instructions call for producing a solution of ceftriaxone that contains 35 g of the provided dry solute with 100 mL of sterile water. What is the

solution.p: We use the definitions for solutions of dry ingredients in a solution.
The dilution ratio is defined to be grams of solute per mL of diluent added. We have 35 g of solute with 100 mL of diluent added, so the ratio is 35/100.

The dilution factor is defined to be grams of solute per mL of solution resulting. We have 35 g of solute in 100 mL of diluent, so the ratio is 35/100. Sometimes it is written as simply 100. Note, this matches dilution ratio because the solute adds almost no volume to the solution (too small to measure).

The percent concentration is defined to be grams of solute per mL of solution resulting written as a percent. We have 35 g of solute in 100 mL of diluent, so the percent is \displaystyle\frac{{35}}{{100}}\cdot{100}={35}\%.
